Mayor and City Council

Pictured standing from left to right: City Attorney Sherri Russell, Councilmember Jon "J.B." Baker, Councilmember Leonard Schooler, Councilmember Vinay Singhania, Councilmember Buster L. Buell, III, City Secretary Sally Villarreal. Seated from left to right: Mayor Pro-Tem Rhonda Seth, Mayor Gerald Roznovsky, and City Manager Modesto Mundo.

It is the mission of the City of Lake Jackson to be a leader among cities and in the region at large in delivering outstanding quality services to all citizens through innovative and efficient use of resources

Agendas and Minutes / Council Packets / Public Hearings The City of Lake Jackson operates under the Council/Manager form of government. The City Council consists of a mayor and five council members, who serve two-year staggered terms and are elected on an at-large basis. You may contact any of your elected officials. They are not assigned to a particular area of Lake Jackson. Citizens may view a copy of the Strategic Plans to grasp a better understanding of the goals and objectives set forth by the City Council.
